intro: Microstylis palawensis, commonly known as the Philippine microstylis, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in mountainous regions. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
